item.author: citizen@nfb.ca (Aaron Lakoff)

Autonomy in the Point looks at the Autonomous Social Centre project, a recent activist initiative to squat an abandoned building and to turn it into a community centre.

item.author: t.mcsorley@nfb.ca (Tim McSorley)
item.description: Denise Hastings and Michelle Drew sat down with filmmaker Astra Taylor to explore growing up unschooled, and debunking some of the myths of homeschooling along the way.
item.itunes:keywords: unschooling, homeschooling, alternative education, school system, learning, Astra Taylor, citizenshift, NFB
item.itunes:author: Tim McSorley

item.title: 77 - Howard Zinn: Taking the Risk for Change - November 28, 2008
item.author: t.mcsorley@nfb.ca (Tim McSorley)
item.description: Teacher, historian and author Howard Zinn speaks to not only what the election of Barack Obama, as America's first Black president, means for the country, but also the major work still needed to improve equality and justice in the United States.
item.itunes:keywords: civil rights, Howard Zinn, risk, social change, United States, citizenshift, NFB
item.itunes:author: Tim McSorley

item.title: 74 - Part III: Activism in Traditional Taumako Culture - June 23, 2008
item.author: dron@nfb.ca (Dave Ron)

item.title: 73 - Black Flags, Books, and a Burgeoning Movement - June 17, 2008
item.author: dron@nfb.ca (David Parker)
item.description: A 22-minute audio documentary on the Montreal Anarchist Bookfair, and topics featured at the event - from current struggles on Tyendinaga Mohawk Territory to building movements in solidarity with prisoners.

item.title: 72 - Aggro-Fuels: The Mean, (Un)Green, Monoculture Machine - May 28, 2008
item.author: dron@nfb.ca (Angela Day)
item.description: A 15-minute audio documentary examining the perils of the booming biofuel industry, including land displacement, human rights violations, and wilderness destruction. Featuring interviews with academics, activists, and displaced persons from Canada to Argentina and Colombia.
item.itunes:keywords: biofuels, biofuel, agrofuels, agrofuel, soy, monoculture, energy security, climate change, energy crisis, food crisis, colombia, argentina, PEI, biodiesel, ethanol, factory farming
item.itunes:author: Dave Ron

item.title: 71 - Architecture of the Occupation: PART II - May 15, 2008
item.author: dron@nfb.ca (David Parker)
item.description: Part two of a two-part podcast that explores the critical theory of Israeli architect and philosopher Eyal Weizman to understand how architecture and urban planning are strategic elements within the Occupied Territories and the Apartheid state; featuring interviews with Palestinians Sayid Ayash and Dr. Ismael Zayid, Dr. Amal Ghazal, and journalist Jon Elmer
item.itunes:keywords: Palestine, israel, palestinian, occupation, apartheid wall, separation barrier, al-naqba, nakba, israeli, middle east conflict, Eyal Weizman, Jon Elmer, Ismael Zayid, occupied territories, west bank, jerusalem, gaza
item.itunes:author: David Parker

item.title: 70 - Architecture of the Occupation: PART I - May 15, 2008
item.author: dron@nfb.ca (David Parker)
item.description: Part one of a two-part podcast that explores the critical theory of Israeli architect and philosopher Eyal Weizman to understand how architecture and urban planning are strategic elements within the Occupied Territories and the Apartheid state; featuring interviews with Palestinians Sayid Ayash and Dr. Ismael Zayid, Dr. Amal Ghazal, and journalist Jon Elmer
item.itunes:keywords: Palestine, israel, palestinian, occupation, apartheid wall, separation barrier, al-naqba, nakba, israeli, middle east conflict, Eyal Weizman, Jon Elmer, Ismael Zayid, occupied territories, west bank, jerusalem, gaza
item.itunes:author: David Parker

item.title: 69 - On the Matter of Tar Sands & Indigenous Lands - May 2, 2008
item.author: d.ron@nfb.ca (Dave Ron)
item.description: A 10 minute video podcast, featuring Cree activist Clayton Thomas-Mueller talking about the impact of the Alberta Tar Sands project on First Nations communities and the work of the Indigenous Environmental Network for environmental justice.
item.itunes:keywords: Clayton Thomas-Mueller, Alberta, tar sands, Athabasca, Cree nation, first nations, oil, winnipeg, indigenous, environmental, indigenous environmental network, health, toxic industry, mining
item.itunes:author: Dave Ron

item.title: 68 - Taking It Back - April 5, 2008
item.author: d.ron@nfb.ca (Dave Ron)
item.description: An hour-long audio-documentary on the special needs provisions in social assistance legislation in Ontario and Nova Scotia and anti-poverty organizations working to dismantle barriers to health, knowing that all welfare recipients are entitled to more money. Produced by Praxis Media Productions.
item.itunes:keywords: HCAP, OCAP, poverty, Canada, ontario, nova scotia, special diets, anti-poverty, clinics, homelessness, poor, welfare, mental health, social assistance
item.itunes:author: Pierre Loiselle, Jill Ratcliffe, Matthew Yates

item.title: 67 - PART III: Welcome to Guantanamo North... - March 21, 2008
item.author: d.ron@nfb.ca (Dave Ron)
item.description: Part three of a timely three-part audio-podcast examining Canada's security certificate legislation, secret trials, and Guantanamo North. It features three prominent voices on the topic: A. Wayne MacKay OC, Barbara Jackman L.L.D., and Matthew Behrens. Produced by AR Khan.

item.title: 07 - Exposing the Sex Industry in Cambodia: Part 3/3 - March 24, 2006
item.description:
Outer Voices is a multi-media project dedicated to listening to, learning from, and sharing with others the seldom-heard voices of grassroots women activists from throughout the Pacific Islands and the Asian Pacific Rim.
We do this because we know that women who work in their own regions, on behalf of their own communities, can effect lasting, non-violent social change. We know that the media can be a tool for getting their stories heard.
Once heard, these stories can provide replicable models for social change in other communities around the world. Outer Voices provides media access to these women and their communities, with the goal of fostering a constructive dialogue among activists and organizations worldwide and in the United States.
item.author: citizen@nfb.ca (Outer Voices/Ex. Producer Stephanie Guyer-Stevens)
item.itunes:keywords: outer voices, international women's week, cambodia, sex, trade, prostitution, interviews, audio,documentary, canada, politics, social, montreal, activism, documentary

item.title: 06 - Exposing the Sex Industry in Cambodia: Part 2/3 - March 15, 2006
item.description:
Outer Voices is a multi-media project dedicated to listening to, learning from, and sharing with others the seldom-heard voices of grassroots women activists from throughout the Pacific Islands and the Asian Pacific Rim.
We do this because we know that women who work in their own regions, on behalf of their own communities, can effect lasting, non-violent social change. We know that the media can be a tool for getting their stories heard.
Once heard, these stories can provide replicable models for social change in other communities around the world. Outer Voices provides media access to these women and their communities, with the goal of fostering a constructive dialogue among activists and organizations worldwide and in the United States.
item.author: citizen@nfb.ca (Outer Voices/Ex. Producer Stephanie Guyer-Stevens)

Outer Voices is a multi-media project dedicated to listening to, learning from, and sharing with others the seldom-heard voices of grassroots women activists from throughout the Pacific Islands and the Asian Pacific Rim.
We do this because we know that women who work in their own regions, on behalf of their own communities, can effect lasting, non-violent social change. We know that the media can be a tool for getting their stories heard.
Once heard, these stories can provide replicable models for social change in other communities around the world. Outer Voices provides media access to these women and their communities, with the goal of fostering a constructive dialogue among activists and organizations worldwide and in the United States.

item.title: 04 - Sophie Harkat Interview - March 3, 2006
item.description: Darren Ell interviews Sophie Harkat, the wife of Mohamed Harkat, who has been held without charge in an Ottawa prison for the last four years. Sophie has been campaigning tirelessly on behalf of her husband against so-called "security certificate" legislation which allows CSIS to detain suspects indefinitely without evidence.
item.author: citizen@nfb.ca (Darren Ell)
item.itunes:keywords: harkat, sophie, mohamed, security, terrorism, interviews, audio,documentary, canada, politics, social, montreal, activism, documentary
item.itunes:author: Darren Ell

item.title: 03 - Mohamed Harkat Interview - February 23, 2006
item.description: Darren Ell interviews Mohamed Harkat, who is being held without charge in an Ottawa prison for the last four years. He is being indefinitely detained under threat of deportation under "security certificate" legislation.
item.author: citizen@nfb.ca (Darren Ell)
